name: 9.1 "Love Is a Really, Really Perfectly Okay..." Trivia Quiz | Television | 10 Questions

questions.text: Did Rebecca tell Robin that she slept with Sam?
questions.explanation:
no.

	She thought Robin was gone for good and was upset which is why she had sex with Sam. However, Robin decided to turn himself in because he said, "what use is my money or my freedom if I can't have the woman I love."

questions.text: Who took a picture of Robin?
questions.explanation:
Carla.

	She wanted a picture of him because she knew the tabloids would pay good money for pictures. She told him, "Let's try it again, only this time look a little more guilty."

questions.text: How much of a raise did Carla and Woody get?
questions.explanation:
$20.

	That was Sam's first promise as the new owner of Cheers, raises across the board. Before this raise they hadn't had a raise in two years.

questions.text: Why wasn't Robin able to get out on bail?
options: They did let him out on bail.
He was really mean to the security guard.
questions.explanation:
He jumped bond earlier.

	Rebecca had ended up taking a job as a waitress at Cheers while she looked for a better job. She told them she wasn't with Robin because he was in jail and they wouldn't grant him bail.

questions.text: Why did Rebecca get angry with Sam?
questions.correct: He wasn't that excited about having sex with her.
options: He was still hitting on her.
He turned Robin in and when he went to jail Rebecca got angry again.
questions.explanation:
He wasn't that excited about having sex with her.

	Sam said that it was like the "Bad News Bears" there was such hype and all about it that when he finally saw it it was a let down. Rebecca got angry saying he was saying the sex was bad so she would sleep with him again to prove how good she could be.

questions.text: What did Sam increase Woody's raise to?
questions.explanation:
$25 a week.

	Woody thought Sam and Rebecca's fighting had to do with the raises given earlier. Woody found out it had nothing to do with him but still complained about only getting $20 after two years so Sam raised his to $25 a week.

the horizontal hokey-pokey.

	Carla always had interesting words to describe things and people. She believed Sam and Rebecca did have sex, but then when Sam wouldn't tell she figured he'd never keep news like that to himself.

questions.text: Why did Sam have so much trouble telling the gang he had sex with Rebecca?
options: He didn't want Rebecca to hurt him.
questions.explanation:
He was being noble.

	Sam told Rebecca "I've never really had a friend before". By "had" he meant he never slept with any of his friends before. He didn't know how to act.

questions.text: How did Sam describe Rebecca's love making to the guys and Carla at the bar?
questions.explanation:
fabulous.

	Rebecca said she knew she was bad and that Robin "didn't know any better because he was English". Sam told her she was good, then he said she was "fabulous".

questions.text: Did the gang believe Sam when he finally told them that he and Rebecca had sex?
questions.explanation:
no.

	They thought he was pathetic because he's never had to lie about having sex before. They didn't believe it because one, he waited so long to tell them, and two, they couldn't believe Rebecca was fabulous.
